snippet: African-Americans around the country say they are counting down the last 10 months of President Obama’s term with pride, sadness and a looming despair.
abstract: African-Americans around the country say they are observing final ten months of Pres Obama's term with pride, but also with sorrow and uncertainty; many say having black president who understands their lives has been tremendously important, but question whether country will ever again vote in president of color.
lead_paragraph: African-Americans around the country say they are counting down the last 10 months of President Obama’s term with pride, sadness and a looming despair.

headline.main: Proud of Obama’s Presidency, Blacks Are Sad to See Him Go
headline.print_headline: Proud of Obama’s Presidency, Blacks Are Sad to See Him Go
